fullText: David Lindsay-Abaire's new play is a thoughtful, well-crafted drama that tackles class differences with uncommon intelligence and wit.
dtliExcerpt: David Lindsay-Abaire's new play is a thoughtful, well-crafted drama that tackles class differences with uncommon intelligence and wit.
bwwExcerpt: Under Daniel Sullivan's sensitive direction, the cast -- including the wryly sharp Estelle Parsons and Becky Ann Baker as Margie's landlady and best friend, respectively -- gives us fully rounded characters that never fall into caricature. Indeed, the play is often very funny, but never at the expense of its ill-starred characters. It's that generosity that makes 'Good People' a good show.
